properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 9 at 3:49PM CST until January 11 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Memphis TN
properties.description:
...Flash Flooding Possible Across Northeast Arkansas and the
Missouri Bootheel Friday Night and Saturday Morning...

.A strong cold front will move through the region starting late
Friday night through Saturday morning. Heavy rainfall is expected
across portions of northeast Arkansas and the Missouri Bootheel
which may produce Flash Flooding in these areas.

The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a

* Flash Flood Watch for portions of East Arkansas and Southeast
Missouri, including the following areas, in East Arkansas,
Clay and Greene. In Southeast Missouri, Dunklin and Pemiscot.

* From Friday evening through Saturday morning

* Over 2 inches of rain is possible through Saturday morning

* Since vegetation is dormant, and not consuming much ground
water, runoff from heavy rain will be increased. This elevates
the concern for flash flooding. Also, rapid rises may occur on
creeks, small streams, and flashy rivers
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING
